column1: Find the DNF of (a −→ b) ∨ c.
Find the CNF of (a −→ b) ∨ c
Find the DNF and CNF of a ∧ (b ←→ c)
Find the DNF and CNF of (a ↔ b) ↔ c from its truth set and falsity set directly.
Define sets A = {1, . . . , 10}, B = {3, 7, 11, 12}, C = {0, 1, . . . , 20}. Which of the following are propositions?
If p → q is false, what is the truth value of ((¬p) ∧ q) ←→ (p ∨ q)?
Show that ((a ∧ b) −→ c) ⇐⇒ ((a −→ c) ∨ (b −→ c))
Work out the truth tables for modus ponens to show that it is a logical implication but not an equivalence.
Simplify (p ∨ (p ∧ q) ∨ (p ∧ q ∧ ¬r)) ∧ ((p ∧ r ∧ t) ∨ t)
